thread.title: The real story behind the Alabama-Washington pre-Peach Bowl handshake
thread.title_full: The real story behind the Alabama-Washington pre-Peach Bowl handshake - The Washington Post

author: washingtonpost blogs
title: The real story behind the Alabama-Washington pre-Peach Bowl handshake
text:
December 31 at 5:27 PM Follow @marissapayne
Calm down, Internet. Everyone shook hands on Saturday. (Jason Getz/USA TODAY Sports) ESPN did a weird thing on Saturday ahead of the Peach Bowl when it circulated a clip online showing Alabama’s captains refusing to shake hands with their Washington counterparts after the coin toss.
Alabama wasn't interested in the pregame handshake today. https://t.co/kYXvQi89kN
— ESPN (@espn) December 31, 2016
The clip went viral quickly, inspiring hundreds of hot takes criticizing the Crimson Tide for being “ embarrassing ” or “ arrogant ” or even “ classless ,” but the network — and many of the other outlets picking up this “story” — left out a pretty important part.
Alabama captains DID shake hands prior to the coin flip. Just not after the coin flip. #CFBPlayoff
— Kevin McGuire (@KevinOnCFB) December 31, 2016
The Crimson Tide didn’t snub anyone, actually. They just shook hands ahead of the coin toss instead of after it.
At press time, Alabama led Washington 17-7 in the third quarter.
